lead_paragraph: Keiko Fujimori, the daughter of a former authoritarian president, had about 38 percent of the vote, with a former prime minister trailing by double digits.

byline.contributor: Andrea Zarate reported from Lima, and Nicholas Casey from Caracas, Venezuela.
byline.original: By ANDREA ZARATE and NICHOLAS CASEY

headline.print_headline: Ex-President’s Daughter Is Headed to a Runoff Vote in Peru
headline.main: Keiko Fujimori, Ex-President’s Daughter, Heads to Runoff in Peru

snippet: Keiko Fujimori, the daughter of a former authoritarian president, had about 38 percent of the vote, with a former prime minister trailing by double digits.
abstract: Keiko Fujimori, daughter of imprisoned former Pres Alberto Fujimori, leads with 38 percent of vote in Peruvian presidential elections; results point to second round of voting.
